title: found node must be a function/thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<dyn Any>' when using nom parser

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code `src/main.rs` is the only file/module, and it looks like this: ```Rust use nom::{character::complete::one_of, combinator::map, IResult}; pub enum Sexpr<'a> { Ident(&'a str), } fn parse_unary_op(s: &str) -> IResult<&str, Sexpr> { map(one_of("+-"), Sexpr::Ident)(s) } fn main() {} ``` I'm using nom v7.1.1.
Cargo.lock

``` # This file is automatically @generated by Cargo. # It is not intended for manual editing. version = 3 [[package]] name = "memchr" version = "2.5.0" source = "registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index" checksum = "2dffe52ecf27772e601905b7522cb4ef790d2cc203488bbd0e2fe85fcb74566d" [[package]] name = "minimal-lexical" version = "0.2.1" source = "registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index" checksum = "68354c5c6bd36d73ff3feceb05efa59b6acb7626617f4962be322a825e61f79a" [[package]] name = "nom" version = "7.1.1" source = "registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index" checksum = "a8903e5a29a317527874d0402f867152a3d21c908bb0b933e416c65e301d4c36" dependencies = [ "memchr", "minimal-lexical", ] [[package]] name = "oxide-lisp" version = "0.1.0" dependencies = [ "nom", ] ```

### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.68.0-nightly (9c07efe84 2022-12-16) binary: rustc commit-hash: 9c07efe84f28a44f3044237696acc295aa407ee5 commit-date: 2022-12-16 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.68.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.6 ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_trait_selection/src/traits/error_reporting/suggestions.rs:3479:28: found node must be a function --> src/main.rs:4:5 | 4 | Ident(&'a str), | ^^^^^ thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/9c07efe84f28a44f3044237696acc295aa407ee5/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:973:33 ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/9c07efe84f28a44f3044237696acc295aa407ee5/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:973:33 stack backtrace: 0: std::panicking::begin_panic:: 1: std::panic::panic_any:: 2: ::span_bug:: 3: ::span_bug:: 4: rustc_middle::ty::context::tls::with_context_opt::::{closure#0}, ()>::{closure#0}, ()> 5: rustc_middle::util::bug::opt_span_bug_fmt:: 6: rustc_middle::util::bug::span_bug_fmt:: 7: rustc_trait_selection::traits::error_reporting::suggestions::hint_missing_borrow 8: ::report_closure_arg_mismatch 9: ::report_selection_error 10: ::report_fulfillment_error 11: ::report_fulfillment_errors 12: ::check_argument_types 13: ::check_call 14: ::check_expr_with_expectation_and_args 15: ::check_call 16: ::check_expr_with_expectation_and_args 17: ::check_block_with_expected 18: ::check_expr_with_expectation_and_args 19: ::check_return_expr 20: rustc_hir_typeck::check::check_fn 21: ::enter::::{closure#0}::{closure#1}, &rustc_middle::ty::typeck_results::TypeckResults> 22: rustc_hir_typeck::typeck 23: >::with_task:: 24: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::> 25: rustc_data_structures::sync::par_for_each_in::<&[rustc_span::def_id::LocalDefId], ::par_body_owners::{closure#0}> 26: rustc_hir_typeck::typeck_item_bodies 27: >::with_task:: 28: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::> 29: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 30: ::time::<(), rustc_hir_analysis::check_crate::{closure#7}> 31: rustc_hir_analysis::check_crate 32: rustc_interface::passes::analysis 33: >::with_task::> 34: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::>> 35: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 36: ::enter::> 37: ::enter::, rustc_errors::ErrorGuaranteed>> 38: rustc_span::with_source_map::, rustc_interface::interface::run_compiler, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}> 39: >::set::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorGuaranteed>> note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.68.0-nightly (9c07efe84 2022-12-16) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: --crate-type bin -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C linker=/usr/bin/clang -C incremental=[REDACTED] -C link-arg=--ld-path=/usr/bin/mold note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [typeck] type-checking `parse_unary_op` #1 [typeck_item_bodies] type-checking all item bodies #2 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack error: could not compile `oxide-lisp` ```
